title: Design Process for Science Learning Motivation Based on Self-Determination Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental science theories and research methodologies
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment for working professionals to enhance scientific competencies.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three psychological needs of Self-Determination Theory (SDT)—autonomy, competence, and relatedness—to science learning contexts.
Learners can predict changes in motivational profiles by comparing the strengths and weaknesses of self-directed learning (SDL) and teacher-directed instruction (TDI).
Learners can design SDT-based learning strategies through project-based assessments and propose improvements incorporating peer feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
